final_report.summary: Mission fe131665 successfully resolved critical infrastructure, dependency, and testing gaps in the AtlasForge system. The mission achieved its primary objectives of fixing Docker configuration errors, adding missing production dependencies, and updating 15 legacy tests to align with current architectural shifts (specifically around Gemini support and tuple-based orchestrator responses). A critical syntax bug in the adversarial testing suite was also resolved. The final test suite pass rate was improved from 94.6% to 99.75%, with 408 out of 409 tests passing.
key_achievements: Restored test suite pass rate to 99.75% across 409 tests.
Corrected Dockerfile port (5010), health check paths, and directory permissions.
Integrated missing dependencies (requests, pyyaml) into the build pipeline.
Resolved a nested f-string syntax error blocking adversarial testing modules.
Updated mocks and state expectations in core tests to match current Gemini-aware orchestration.
challenges_overcome: Reconciling legacy test mocks with new subprocess.Popen environment handling.
Fixing subtle Docker permission issues that prevented container startup as a non-root user.
Aligning test expectations with recent changes in StateManager and StageHandler return structures.
lessons_learned: System-level mocks require tight synchronization with orchestration logic changes (e.g., adding env variables).
Docker health checks must be precise with API routing (e.g., /api/health vs /health).
Automated dependency scanning is essential to prevent runtime ModuleNotFoundErrors after module additions.
